data.title: 4 Languages of Comoros
data.meta_description: What languages are spoken in Comoros? Some of the major languages include French and Shikomoro, as well as others, some of which have an official status. Other languages include Malagasy and Swahili. Read more about the most prominent languages of the Comorian market in this article.
data.text:
In this series of articles we overview languages present in any given country. This time we are looking at the languages spoken in Comoros

The biggest languages present in Comoros include:

French – 209 thousand speakers;

Shikomoro – 844 thousand speakers;

Malagasy – 35 thousand speakers;

Swahili – 9 thousand speakers;

The following languages are legally recognized as the “official languages” of the country:

Comorian

French

Arabic

Below you will find summaries for the languages supported by our translation services.

French

French is a Romance language, closely related to Romanian, Catalan, Portuguese, Spanish, and other languages of the same branch of the language family. It is one of the official languages of Comoros, alongside 3 other.

French language summaryNumber of speakers worldwide274 million Language familyIndo-European WritingFrench alphabet Major French-speaking populations in:49 countries

Demographics and geographic distribution

French is spoken by around 274 million people around the world. With regard to the number of speakers, the most notable 3 countries are France, Canada, and Switzerland.

Around 24% of the population of Comoros speak French.

Writing

French uses the Latin alphabet. It employs the extended version of the script, however, with 16 additional symbols. It is written from left to right.
